briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Esomeprazole Once Daily for the Treatment of GERD in Neonatal Patients

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Full-term or gestational age \>/= 28 to 44 weeks
* In-patient in Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, special care nursery, or equivalent
* Patient must be on a stable mode of feeding or with minimal variations for at least 2 days prior to randomization

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with a need for resectional or reconstructive surgery of the gastrointestinal tract
* Patients with any condition that may require surgery during the course of the study
* Patients with acute respiratory distress within 72 hours prior to enrollment

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Normalized Number of GERD Events Observed From Video and Cardiorespiratory Monitoring
outcomeMeasures.description: The number of events are normalized prior to summary to correspond to a complete 8-hour monitoring period. Only patients with data at both baseline and final assessment are included.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Normalized Number of GERD Events During Video and Cardiorespiratory Monitoring Associated With Acid Reflux
outcomeMeasures.description: Event considered associated with reflux if start time of GERD sign/symptom is within 2 minutes of start time of acid reflux. The number of events are normalized prior to summary to correspond to a complete 8-hour monitoring period. Only patients with data at both baseline and final assessment are included.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Number of Reflux Episodes (Acid or Non-acid)
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of reflux episodes based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Number of Acidic Reflux Episodes
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of reflux episodes (pH\<4.0) based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Number of Weakly Acidic Reflux Episodes
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of reflux episodes (pH 4.0-6.9) based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Number of Non Acidic Reflux Episodes
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of reflux episodes (pH\>=7.0) based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Number of Liquid Acidic Reflux Episodes
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of reflux episodes based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Number of Mixed Gas/Liquid Acidic Reflux Episodes
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of reflux episodes based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Mean Bolus Clearance Time
Change From Baseline in Mean Acid Clearance Time
Change From Baseline in Percentage Time With pH<4.0
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage time with pH\<4 during 24-hour pH monitoring

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Percentage Time With pH Within 4.0-6.9
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage time with pH 4.0-6.9 during 24-hour pH monitoring
